abstract: Grove Street Cemetery in New Haven, Conn, is one of oldest operating burial grounds in United States, and the nation's first planned cemetery; hundreds of notable figures are interred at Grove Street, which was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1997 (Metropolitan/Connecticut).
lead_paragraph: Grove Street Cemetery in New Haven, where Eli Whitney, Noah Webster and other notable figures lieare buried, was started because of epidemics of yellow fever and scarlet fever and opened in 1797.

headline.main: The Nation’s First Planned Burial Ground
headline.print_headline: A Place of History, Urban Legend and Eternal Rest

snippet: Grove Street Cemetery in New Haven, where Eli Whitney, Noah Webster and other notable figures lieare buried, was started because of epidemics of yellow fever and scarlet fever and opened in 1797.
